parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
From behind, after. From opis with enclitic of source; from the rear, i.e. At the back.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The fringe, edge, corner, tassel. Of uncertain derivation; a margin, i.e., a fringe or tassel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
Instantly, immediately, on the spot. From para and chrema; at the thing itself, i.e. Instantly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
